text: Manolo Gabbiadini (born 26 November 1991) is an Italian professional footballer. He plays as a striker for UAE Pro League club Al-Nasr and the Italy national team. He is a former Italy under-20 and under-21 international. Gabbiadini was born in Calcinate. Between 2009 and 2013, he played for Atalanta, Cittadella, Juventus and Bologna. In 2013, he signed for Sampdoria. In July 2015, he was sold to Napoli, before moving to English side Southampton during in January 2017. In 2019, he returned to Sampdoria. On 12 March 2020, during the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic, it was made clear that Gabbiadini had tested positive for COVID-19. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Club Season League National cup League cup Continental Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Atalanta 2009–10 Serie A 2 0 0 0 — — 2 0 2011–12 Serie A 23 1 1 1 — — 24 1 Total 25 1 1 1 — — 26 2 Cittadella (loan) 2010–11 Serie B 27 5 2 0 — — 29 5 Bologna (loan) 2012–13 Serie A 39 6 1 1 — — 31 7 Sampdoria 2013–14 Serie A 34 8 1 2 — — 35 10 2014–15 Serie A 13 7 2 2 — — 15 9 Total 47 15 3 4 — — 50 19 Napoli 2014–15 Serie A 20 8 4 1 — 6 2 30 11 2015–16 Serie A 23 5 1 0 — 6 4 30 9 2016–17 Serie A 13 3 1 1 — 5 1 19 5 Total 56 16 6 2 — 17 7 79 25 Southampton 2016–17 Premier League 11 4 0 0 1 2 0 0 12 6 2017–18 Premier League 28 5 4 0 1 0 — 33 5 2018–19 Premier League 12 1 0 0 3 0 — 15 1 Total 51 10 4 0 5 2 0 0 60 12 Sampdoria 2018–19 Serie A 18 4 0 0 — — 18 4 2019–20 Serie A 33 11 2 1 — — 35 12 2020–21 Serie A 16 3 1 0 — — 17 3 2021–22 Serie A 18 6 3 1 — — 21 7 2022–23 Serie A 35 7 1 0 — — 36 7 Total 120 31 7 2 — — 127 33 Al-Nasr 2023–24 UAE Pro League 4 2 0 0 — — 4 2 Career total 360 86 24 10 5 2 17 7 406 105 ===International=== National team Year Apps Goals Italy 2012 1 0 2013 0 0 2014 1 0 2015 4 1 2016 0 0 2017 5 1 2022 2 0 Total 13 2 :Scores and results list Italy's goal tally first.
